activities.name: Spring Blooms in Bergen Parks
activities.description: Experience the arrival of spring in Bergen's parks like Nygårdsparken or the Muséhagen Botanical Garden. Enjoy early flowers and the greening landscape after the winter rains.
activities.seasonal_notes: Blooming times vary with weather. Spring in Bergen often starts wet but gradually warms up, with average temperatures around 5-12°C (41-54°F) in April/May. Be prepared for rain!
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed. Dress in layers and bring waterproof gear. Muséhagen (Botanical Garden at University Museum) is particularly lovely.

activities.name: Visit Muséhagen (Botanical Garden)
activities.description: Explore the historic Botanical Garden at the University Museum on Nygårdshøyden as it comes alive with spring blooms. Features diverse plant collections in a peaceful setting.
activities.seasonal_notes: Rhododendrons and other spring flowers put on a good show. Less crowded than peak summer.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required for the garden. Combine with a visit to the University Museum's indoor collections.

activities.name: May 17th Constitution Day Celebrations
activities.description: Witness Bergen's vibrant celebration of Norway's National Day. Enjoy parades (including the unique 'Buekorps' marching brigades), traditional costumes (bunad), music, and festivities throughout Sentrum.
activities.seasonal_notes: A major celebration in Bergen, known for its unique traditions like the Buekorps. The city is decorated and full of energy.
activities.booking_tips: Find a spot along the parade routes in Sentrum early. Restaurants will be very busy; book well in advance if planning to dine out.

activities.name: Hike Mount Fløyen or Ulriken Trails
activities.description: As snow melts, hike the trails on Bergen's city mountains, Fløyen and Ulriken. Enjoy improving views and emerging spring nature. Start with lower trails if higher elevations are still snowy/muddy.
activities.seasonal_notes: Trail conditions vary greatly in spring. Check weather forecasts and trail status. Lower trails clear first. Views become clearer as weather improves.
activities.booking_tips: Wear proper hiking boots with good grip. Bring layers, waterproofs, water, and snacks. Fløibanen funicular and Ulriksbanen cable car offer easier access to the top.

activities.name: Fjord Cruise Season Starts/Increases
activities.description: Take a fjord cruise from Bergen harbor to explore the stunning nearby fjords like Osterfjord and Mostraumen. Spring offers dramatic scenery with melting snow feeding waterfalls.
activities.seasonal_notes: Fewer sailings than summer, but less crowded. Waterfalls are often spectacular due to snowmelt. Weather can be unpredictable; dress warmly.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance, especially for popular routes like the Mostraumen cruise. Choose enclosed seating options if weather is poor.

activities.name: Midsummer Celebrations (Sankt Hans/Jonsok)
activities.description: Experience Norwegian Midsummer (June 23rd) with bonfires, often held at coastal locations near Bergen or sometimes at specific city spots like the Norwegian Fisheries Museum.
activities.seasonal_notes: Celebrating the longest day of the year. Bergen's long summer daylight enhances the festive mood.
activities.booking_tips: Check local event listings (e.g., Visit Bergen website, local newspapers) for specific locations and timings of public bonfires.

activities.name: Swimming at City Beaches/Pools
activities.description: Take a refreshing dip at Bergen's swimming spots. Options include Nordnes Sjøbad (heated seawater pool & fjord access), Sandviken Sjøbad (diving tower), or the beach at Marineholmen.
activities.seasonal_notes: Fjord temperatures remain cool even in summer ('refreshing'!). Nordnes Sjøbad offers a heated option.
activities.booking_tips: Check opening times for Nordnes Sjøbad and Sandviken Sjøbad. Marineholmen is freely accessible.

activities.name: Explore Bryggen Hanseatic Wharf
activities.description: Wander through the iconic UNESCO World Heritage site of Bryggen, exploring its narrow passages, historic wooden buildings, museums (Hanseatic, Bryggens), shops, and galleries.
activities.seasonal_notes: Peak tourist season means Bryggen is lively but can be crowded. Long daylight hours allow for extended exploration.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid the biggest cruise ship crowds. Wear comfortable shoes for uneven wooden walkways.

activities.name: Hike or Ride up Fløyen/Ulriken
activities.description: Take the Fløibanen funicular or Ulriksbanen cable car, or hike up Bergen's city mountains for stunning panoramic views, hiking trails, playgrounds (Fløyen), and restaurants.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers the best chance for clear views and comfortable hiking conditions. Fløyen is particularly family-friendly.
activities.booking_tips: Book funicular/cable car tickets online to potentially skip queues, especially during peak season. Check operating hours.

activities.name: Outdoor 'Utepils' and Dining Season
activities.description: Enjoy an 'utepils' (outdoor beer) or meal at the many restaurants and bars with outdoor seating, especially popular along Bryggen, Zachariasbryggen (Fish Market area), and streets in Sentrum.
activities.seasonal_notes: Bergeners flock outdoors when the sun shines. Waterfront spots are particularly popular.
activities.booking_tips: Prime outdoor spots fill up quickly on sunny days. Reservations might be helpful for popular restaurants, especially on weekends.

activities.name: Attend Summer Festivals (e.g., Bergenfest)
activities.description: Experience Bergen's summer festival scene. Events like Bergenfest (usually June) bring international and local artists to venues like Bergenhus Fortress.
activities.seasonal_notes: Check schedules for various music, food, or cultural festivals happening during the summer months.
activities.booking_tips: Buy tickets well in advance for major festivals. Check festival websites for lineups, schedules, and venue information.

activities.name: Autumn Colors Hiking (Fløyen/Ulriken/Stoltzekleiven)
activities.description: Hike Bergen's city mountains to witness beautiful autumn foliage. Trails on Fløyen, Ulriken, or the challenging Stoltzekleiven offer stunning views coloured by fall.
activities.seasonal_notes: Bergen's autumn can be very wet, but clear days offer spectacular colors against the fjord and city. Temperatures cool down, averaging 8-13°C (46-55°F) in Sep/Oct.
activities.booking_tips: Check weather forecast carefully. Wear waterproof gear and sturdy hiking boots. Stoltzekleiven is steep and can be slippery when wet.

activities.name: Explore Bergen's Museums
activities.description: Dive into Bergen's rich culture and history at its many museums. Visit KODE art museums, the Hanseatic Museum, Bryggens Museum, Norwegian Fisheries Museum, or the University Museum.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect activity for rainy autumn days. Fewer crowds than summer.
activities.booking_tips: Consider the Bergen Card for free/discounted entry to many museums and public transport. Check opening hours as some may reduce hours after summer.

activities.name: Enjoy Bergen's Seafood
activities.description: Savor fresh seafood at Bergen's Fish Market (Fisketorget) or in restaurants. While available year-round, autumn is a good time for shellfish and traditional dishes like Persetorsk (cod).
activities.seasonal_notes: The indoor part of the Fish Market offers warmth. Many restaurants feature seasonal seafood.
activities.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for popular seafood restaurants. The Fish Market offers both ready-to-eat options and fresh seafood to buy.

activities.name: Attend Cultural Events
activities.description: Check schedules for concerts at Grieghallen, performances at Den Nationale Scene (theatre), or events at cultural hubs like USF Verftet.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn marks the start of the main cultural season after the summer break.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance for popular performances or concerts. Check venue websites for programs.

activities.name: Cozy Up in Cafés and Pubs
activities.description: Experience Norwegian 'kos' (coziness) as the days get shorter and wetter. Enjoy coffee and cake (like the local 'Skillingsbolle' cinnamon bun) in charming cafes or relax in traditional pubs.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect way to escape the autumn rain. Look for cafes in Nordnes, Sandviken, or Sentrum.
activities.booking_tips: No reservations usually needed for cafes or casual pubs. Try traditional spots like Pingvinen for Norwegian pub food.

activities.name: Bergen Christmas Market at Festplassen
activities.description: Visit Bergen's main Christmas market located at Festplassen by the lake Lille Lungegårdsvannet. Features food stalls, crafts, a Ferris wheel, and festive lights.
activities.seasonal_notes: Creates a festive atmosphere in the city center. Bergen winters are often mild and wet, but can bring snow.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required. Dress very warmly and wear waterproofs. Try local Christmas treats and 'gløgg' (mulled wine).

activities.name: Ice Skating at Festplassen (Seasonal Rink)
activities.description: Enjoy ice skating on the temporary rink usually set up alongside the Christmas Market at Festplassen.
activities.price_range: Free (If you bring own skates)/Budget (Skate rental)
activities.seasonal_notes: Operation depends on the seasonal setup and weather conditions.
activities.booking_tips: Check if the rink is operational during your visit. Skate rental typically available on site.

activities.name: Winter Views from Fløyen or Ulriken
activities.description: Take the Fløibanen funicular or Ulriksbanen cable car (check winter operation) for potentially snow-dusted panoramic views of Bergen and the fjords. Enjoy the cozy restaurant/cafe at the top.
activities.seasonal_notes: Views can be spectacular with snow, but visibility depends heavily on weather. Mountains can be windy and cold.
activities.booking_tips: Check winter operating schedules for Fløibanen and Ulriksbanen, as they may be reduced or closed for maintenance. Dress very warmly.

activities.name: Visit Indoor Attractions
activities.description: Escape the winter weather at Bergen's indoor attractions like the KODE Art Museums, Bergen Aquarium (Akvariet), VilVite Science Centre, or various historical museums.
activities.seasonal_notes: Ideal for cold or rainy winter days.
activities.booking_tips: Check opening hours, as some attractions might have reduced winter schedules. Consider the Bergen Card.

activities.name: Winter Sauna and Fjord Dip
activities.description: Brave the cold with a session at one of Bergen's floating saunas (e.g., Heit Bergen Sauna in Sandviken or Møhlenpris/Laksevåg), followed by an invigorating dip in the icy fjord.
activities.seasonal_notes: A trendy and traditional wellness experience. Very popular, especially in winter.
activities.booking_tips: Book well in advance, especially for weekends. Bring swimwear, towels, and potentially flip-flops.

activities.name: Enjoy Festive Lights and Atmosphere
activities.description: Stroll through Sentrum and Bryggen in the evenings to enjoy the Christmas lights and decorations, creating a cozy and festive atmosphere despite the dark winter nights.
activities.seasonal_notes: Bergen's narrow streets and historic buildings look particularly charming with festive lighting.
activities.booking_tips: Combine with a visit to the Christmas market or cozying up in a pub/cafe afterwards. Dress warmly.
